More information:
As you can see from the supplied code, clicking the Tray Item causes a PopupDialog to open.  The PopupDialog automatically closes when it loses focus. This is a timing-related bug so I added a 2-second delay in the open() method to make it easily reproducible.

When you double-click on the tray item, the first click causes the PopupDialog open() method to be called, and then before that method returns the close() method is called, I think because Windows is processing the second click.

This results in the display variable of the PopupDialog being set to null, which later results in a NullPointerException (still within the PopupDialog.open() method).

I think the culprit here might be the Shell.open() method, line 1098.  It is doing some low-level windows hack I don't understand, but anyway it's that method call which causes PopupDialog.close() to be called.

This bug is probably not related to the System Tray widget I have used in the example, but that's how I found it and it is reproducible every time using this code.
